taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Country name Mexico and Latin malva , mallow]

bio:treatment.description: Subshrubs. Stems erect, stellate-tomentose. Leaves distichous and alternate; stipules persistent, linear; blade narrowly ovate or oblong-lanceolate, unlobed, base cordate, margins serrate, surfaces stellate-hairy. Inflorescences axillary, solitary flowers; involucel absent. Flowers: calyx not accrescent, not inflated, lobes unribbed, wide-ovate; corolla rotate, dark purple [lavender or purple]; staminal column included; style 7- or 8-branched; stigmas capitate. Fruits schizocarps,
bio:treatment.discussion: Species 2 (1 in the flora): Texas, n, c Mexico.
The second species, Meximalva venusta (Schlechtendal) Fryxell, is known only from Mexico.
